str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Recognition, reading; public reading (of the law and prophets in synagogue or church). From anaginosko; reading.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From arche and sunagoge; director of the synagogue services.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
From parakaleo; imploration, hortation, solace.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
